label: Mrs. Duckett's Petition Letter to the St. Andrew's Society
description: A letter from a woman who is seeking financial aid from the St. Andrew's Society after her husband died and then her daughter died, leaving her with a granddaughter to care for.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: A letter from a woman who is seeking financial aid from the St. Andrew's Society after her husband died and then her daughter died, leaving her with a granddaughter to care for.

metadata.label: Access Note
metadata.value: For more information contact Special Collections at Addlestone Library, College of Charleston, Charleston, SC, 29424.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
To the Honble [honorable] John Cleland Esq. President, the officers and members of the St. Andrews Club at Charles Town in South Carolina.

The Humble Petition of Ian Duckett	

Sheweth

That your petitioner is widow of Robert Duccat born at Findorn North Britain which he left and acted in this Province many years as a pilot.  
That your petitioner's daughter, Lillia Duccat married Robert Corsan born at Edinburgh aforesaid.  
That in the year 1745 sd. Robert Corsan died and left one child Margaret Corsan which with the petitioner was maintained by her said daughter Lillia Corsan 'till she died in 1749 and ever since your petitioner has by her industry and labour endeavoured [sic] to maintain her self and her granddaughter Margaret Corsan an infant of six years old.

Your petitioner is now very infirm being fifty five years of age and has been for some time past partly supported by the charity of her acquaintances.  

Your petitioner therefore humbly prays that you will be pleased to take her case into consideration and grant your petitioner such relief as to you shall seem meet.

And your petitioner shall ever pray etc...
